page.title: 07LIFEGUARDS AT SANDYMOUTH
page.content: On Sandymouth Beach from the end of May to mid-September, 2 lifeguards are on duty between 10:00 and 6:00. Their first duty is to check the surf conditions and decide on the siting of the safe bathing area flags.If they consider that no bathing is possible, then a{red flag}is shown. The times of safe-bathing are also posted on a clear sign by the beach track. They then keep a close watch on the beach and often wade into the water if there is a large number of people in the sea.It is important that they are strong swimmers and can apply{ {resuscitation techniques.}A{Petersen {Tube}and{Rescue Board}are on the beach for immediate use.As the tide advances the flags are moved further back up the beach.In good weather the duty hours may be extended if a large number of bathers remain after 6:00.
